item.title: UPM | Investigation company with a loss of 47 thousand patacas
item.description:
In the early year, the technological innovation of the Macao Polytechnic University (UPM) recorded a loss of 47.2 thousand patacas. However, the administration provides for profits this year, due to a contract that can reach the amount of 640 thousand patacas
In the first two months of operation, the technological innovation of the Polytechnic University of Macau (UPM) had a loss of 47,200 patacas. The results of the 2024 UPM investigation company were released yesterday, through the Portal of the Directorate of Supervision and Management of Public Assets (DSSGAP). According to the annual report of activities, in two months of 2024 the company registered revenues of 10,522 patacas, and the expense reached 57,771 patacas, which led to a final damage of 47,249 patacas. The main expense, in the amount of 55,000 patacas, arrested on the hiring of “professional services. In addition, there were administrative expenses related to the staff of the 2,771 patacas company.“ Since the company is still in the initial phase of operations, the expenses were essentially the expenses to establish and start operations ”, was explained about the amounts spent. Despite the losses, Marcus Im Sio Kei, chairman of the company's Board of Directors and Rector of UPM, is confident about the future. "The year 2024 was the foundation of the company. Despite the initial challenges, solid foundations for future development were launched," said IM. Optimistic perspectives The report also leaves an optimistic message for the future, since at the end of 2024 the company signed a cooperation agreement that is expected to generate revenues of 640 thousand patacas. The document is no use details about this contract, as parties involved, nor the variable conditions that may affect revenues. However, the board of directors believes that the new project will ensure that the company can make profits later this year. In terms of the company's objectives for the current year, Marcus im Sio Kei defined the contribution to the economic and social development of the territory and the diversification of the economy. "In 2025, the company will perform its activity based on academic resources and the innovative force of the Macao Polytechnic University and focus on technological development to achieve the two objectives of contributing to economic and social development and injecting new vitality to the economic diversification of Macao," he is pointed out. The technological innovation of the Polytechnic University of Macau (UPM) is detained at 100 percent by the UPM and has a capital of 200 thousand patacas. The company was created at the end of last year to develop “activities in the areas of professional research, professional services, technological, scientific innovation and continuous education”. The services available also include activities of “consulting, counseling, technology transfer and assistance”, “commercial financing management in other companies, engineering tests” and “availability of training courses”.

item.title: Ormuz Strait | Closing can make inflation trigger
item.description:
The president of the Macao Suppliers Association, IP Sio Man, warns that in case of blocking the impact should begin to be felt within two to three months. Some prices may rise up to 10 percent
The possibility of going on to advance with the closure of the Ormuz Strait can shoot inflation in Macao. The scenario was drawn by the president of the Macao Suppliers Union Association, IP Sio Man, in statements to the newspaper or Mun. After US and Israelite bombings against Iran, the possibility of the country ending the Strait of Ormuz was advanced. IP Sio Man acknowledged that the negative effects of closing will affect mashes to consumer goods prices and should begin to feel more intensely about two to three months after blocking. The Association's president estimated that the closure will lead to the “inevitable increase in prices” from about 5 to 10 percent. Price growth will take about two to three months to feel, because many of the importers and distributors have reserves of products that can be affected, so they can be sold at current prices. However, when new more expensive products are imported, prices in Macau will also reflect this increase. IP Sio Man also indicated that after the beginning of the war between Israel, the US and Iran, the cost of insurance for maritime transport increased by 50 percent. Oil prices rose about six percent. The president of the association also indicated that with the blockade of the Strait of Ormuz, the maritime transport that currently takes three months will take four to five months. Faced with this scenario, IP believes that the impact on the level of goods transport between and Asia and Europe will be similar to what happened during the pandemic. China more protected Despite the negative panorama, IP Sio Man also pointed out that China is better prepared to face the impact than regions such as Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, Macao or others from Southeast Asia. The president pointed out that rail transport between China and Europe can be an alternative for transporting some products and is currently used for most consumed high-class goods, such as wines, liqueurs, dairy products, sweets, chocolates and cookies. An area where Macao should be impacted is at first -need goods, such as cereals, food oil and other foods, since these products originated in the interior of China and the countries of Southeast Asia. The newspaper or Mun article also cites an anonymous supplier that indicates that Europe is not a source of imports in Macao and that the impact should not be much felt. The same anonymous source indicated that since the pandemic, Macau began to diversify the fate of imports of imports, looking for alternatives in Southeast Asia. This supplier also indicated to expect a moderate impact on inflation level, because consumption inside China is in retraction due to the employment crisis on the other side of the border.

item.title: Eleicons | Wong wai man definitely deleted
item.description:
The chairman of the Electoral Affairs Commission of the Legislative Assembly confirmed yesterday the definitive removal from the Wong Wai Man list, after the activist, known as 'Captain Macau', did not appeal the exclusion
"We have not received any appeal or information about any appeal so far," Judge Seng Ioi Man said yesterday, who chairs the Electoral Affairs Committee of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal). According to the chronology of the electoral process, Wong Wai Man had only one day to appeal, to the Last Instance Court (TUI), of the rejection of the candidacy, a decision announced by Caeal on June 16. Tui would later have five days, until last Sunday, to make a “definitive decision” on exclusion. On June 10, Caeal gave Wong Wai Man two days to collect at least 78 signatures in support of its candidacy. This after the commission decides that of the 395 signatures submitted by the activist, only 222 were valid. C candidates must be presented with a minimum support of 300 voters. "Most of the signatures were not from voters who gather the conditions, there are also repetition of subscribers and signatures that do not correspond to the identity document," said Seng Ioi Man on June 16, noting problems with the list logo aid grassroots. The next day, Wong Wai Man, also president of the Iron and Steel Association, accused the political persecution authorities, said he was detained between June 11 and 16 and rejected the charges of electoral corruption and illicit exploitation of play. Reduced space On 14 June, the criminal courts applied coercion measures to five individuals, allegedly because they paid bribes to obtain support for candidates for the Legislative Assembly or for falsifying signatures. Wong Wai Man, also known as “Mao Soldier” for often appearing with a green uniform and a bag with the face of former Chinese leader Mao Zedong, ensured that he had no money to pay bribes. Caeal President Seng Ioi Man said yesterday that he did not or will ask for information from the commissioner against corruption, because the investigation is still "under the secret of justice." These will be the first elections after the exclusion in 2021 of five lists and 21 candidates, 15 of which pro-democracy, for “not defending the basic law” and not being “faithful to mashes”. The Electoral Commission validated eight requests for direct suffrage to the AL, less than the 19 initially filed in the previous elections in 2021. Thirty -three deputies are part of AL, 14 of which are elected by direct suffrage, 12 by indirect suffrage, through associations, and seven are appointed by the chief executive.

item.title: Public function | Request Review of Assiduity Control
item.description:
Nick Law suggested to the government the installation of identity recognition systems to reinforce the registration of attendance and absences of civil servants. The deputy requested the increase in inspection following a CCAC report relating to last year, where cases of counterfeit of presence were identified
The final report of the Commissioner Against Corruption (CCAC), relating to last year, revealed the increase of complaints compared to 2023, cases of abuse of the registration system and absences between administration officials, with particular emphasis on the most glaring cases involving the Public Security Police and customs services. CCAC's conclusions were the target of a written Nick Law interpellation, released yesterday, which linked a position of greater control of public services in the mechanisms of registration of attendance and absences. The deputy linked to the Fujian community asks the government to do “an exhaustive analysis of the current methods of registration of attendance of various public services”. In addition, it suggests the updating of attendance registration equipment through identity recognition systems to eliminate irregularities. The deputy argues that CCAC has shown that among the security forces there are those who "enjoy their positions", "frequently leaving during the service and even abandoning the territory." Nick Law also did not forget the role of doctors in obtaining false justification for long absence of the service, or situations where "some civil servants marked the point for each other." The legislator argues that "these violations not only harm the rule of law in Macao, but also affect society's confidence in the executive's governance." Devil in the details Nick Lei recalls that the CCAC report highlighted the work done to increase the awareness of the population and civil servants regarding the promotion of integral and honest conduct. Last year, 622 lectures, seminars, training workshops and activities of various types were held, with 41,901 participants, including civil servants, public and private institutions and students. However, CCAC revealed the increase in offenses to discipline and law committed by civil servants. As such, the deputy asks if the government will evaluate the effectiveness of these actions. Another area in which Nick Law would like to see improvements is in CCAC's own reports. The deputy indicates that the body failed to specify, from 2018, detailed statistics on the public services of complaints. The deputy suggested that CCAC will return to the public services of complaints "so that the public can know the problems of each functional area and facilitate the joint supervision of society."

item.title: Coloane | Filipe Afonso launches work that highlights the importance of staff houses
item.description:
The latest book by Filipe Afonso, coordinator of the Architecture course at the University of São José, looks at a housing model at risk of disappearing, but can be seen in Coloane, or in old fishing zones of Hong Kong. “Coloane Grammar” presents alternative solutions for the reuse of these houses and their classification as a heritage
Taking the idea of ​​grammar that names the book, what are the main terms or concepts around Coloane, its tradition and preservation that can enumerate? The “grammar” of the book introduces the concept of vernacular architecture, which reflects the knowledge of the informal, local construction and the maritime identity of this Coloane community. It addresses the assets at risk, proposing a method of cataloging existing houses, this digital method, which establishes a dialogue between tradition and modernity to preserve this cultural landscape. What concrete proposals are suggested in the book for the protection and preservation of Coloane's stilts? The book proposes (indirectly) the classification of stilts as a heritage to give them legal protection. By cataloging existing stilts, the book contributes to preserving the memory of this type of architecture and a broader discussion about its possible protection. How could we reuse the stilts taking into account these specific ways of life and the economic diversification that the government wants to achieve? The stilts could be reused for experience tourism, or centers of cultural interpretation, valuing local history. They can be transformed into creative and artistic spaces or in fact propose new wood buildings along the water line, with various uses and that can generate value to the Coloane community, contributing to Macao's cultural and economic diversification. Why approach Coloane and the stilts? How did this project come about? Coloane and the stilts were approached by their architectural and cultural uniqueness, representing a threatened memory and identity of Macao. This assets at risk has a significant potential. The project also emerged from the gap of scientific knowledge about these structures and the urgent need for documentation, consolidating itself as an academic-scientific investigation. In the Asian or Southeast Asian context, are the coloane stilts or not unique in architectural terms? Water constructions are common in various Asian countries, Coloane's stilts are not a unique case in terms of existence. See the example, in Hong Kong, of the well-known Tai o village, but are unique in their specific context. Its architecture is the reflection of local regional influences and materials, adapted to the history of the evolution of Colona's fishing community and the development of Macao. Its value lies in its particular architectural language and its persistence in a rapidly transformed urban environment. What is the story behind the emergence of stilts? Are you associated with Coloane piracy reports, for example, which refer to the early twentieth century? The stilts emerged as a practical and functional solution to the sea -related way of life, allowing sea access, tidal protection and efficient use of space in coastal areas. Piracy reports in Coloane were not the direct cause of their emergence. Shapes are essentially the response of an informal architecture of local communities to adapt to the maritime environment. Museum Idea on Coloane Stop Stand since 2017 The need for preservation of coloane stilts is not a recent idea. Between 2017 and 2018, the Directorate of Tourism Services proposed the creation of a museum entirely dedicated to the stories of these dwellings arranged in Rua dos Navegantes, but the project was being postponed for legal reasons. In 2018, the Tribuna de Macao newspaper (JTM) published an article where it referred precisely the absence of “legal foundations” for the construction of new infrastructure in the Maritime area of ​​Macao, something that has changed, however, given that the MSAR passed, from 2018, to include in its jurisdiction the management of 85 square kilometers of maritime zones. Last year alone, the executive's plans for the creation of a “functional maritime zoning”, “maritime areas” and other related laws, and a concrete decision on what will be made on what will be made on the stilts. Both zoning and plan will be defined for a temporal period by 2040. One of the objectives of the executive is environmental and ecological preservation, as well as certain experiences of the population. One of the points of the public consultation report speaks of “optimizing ocean exploration modalities according to Macau's development needs; coordinating the use of sea in production, daily life of the population and ecology” and performing “intensive and economizers uses to realize the rational allocation of maritime resources”. In 2018, according to the JTM, STD assured that it would be necessary to “wait for the publication of the maritime area and administrative regulation on the administration of the use of maritime zones” and only then could you think of the planning of the museum. HM questioned STD of this article, and until the closing of this edition, obtained new clarifications. A gradual development In a master's dissertation in architecture, defended in 2023 at the University of Coimbra, Ana Rita Rodrigues made the study of the “Evolution of Macao Territory-Aterros and Urban Design in the Taipa and Coloane islands”, and concluded that “Portuguese occupation in the islands of Taipa and Coloane brought improvements in infrastructure, safety and village organization”. In the late nineteenth century, "there were already, in the islands, schools, hospitals and basic infrastructure, promoting the economic growth of the region." Referring to the existence of stilts “used for the construction of fishing and housing boats for fishermen, naturally facing the river”, in a coloane zone composed “by precarious housing of one or two floors, unlike the type of common housing found in mud or macao, which was more focused on high development”. The author also points out that “development was slower” in Coloane, as well as the absence, on both islands, of “a unified general plan and the need for better urban planning to ensure a cohesive and sustainable environment”.

item.title: Academy announces cinema support candidates until July 20
item.description: The applications and submission of projects for the “International Film Camp” initiative (IFC, in the English), promoted by the Asian Academy of Cinema Awards and supported by Sands China. item.title: Visit | XI defends reinforcement of cooperation with Singapore
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping yesterday defended the “Strengthening of Strategic Communication” with Singapore, during a meeting with the Prime Minister of the Insular Nation, Lawrence Wong, in Beijing. XI, who congratulated Wong for victory in last month's parliamentary elections, indicated that, “in the current international situation of interconnected changes and chaos, China is willing to strengthen strategic communication with Singapore”, according to a statement widespread by state television CCTV. The Chinese leader urged both parties to "strengthen cooperation ties, work together to face challenges, and generate greater benefits to peoples from both countries." Wong said that "the importance of relationships between China and Singapore is greater than ever in a turbulent world situation," according to CCTV. “We can work together to build more narrow bilateral relationships and strengthen regional and multilateral cooperation to strengthen multilateralism, protect international rules and order and benefit all countries in the world,” said Wong, who chose China as his first international official trip outside Southeast Asian after May elections. Unquestionable victory Wong ascended as Prime Minister of Singapore in May 2024, when the predecessor, Lee Hsien Loong, left office after almost two decades in power. In the May elections, his party, the Popular Action Party (PAP), which has been in power in Singapore for six decades, has managed to wage the fall and wage the rise of a reduced opposition, winning 87 of the 97 seats in Parliament. China maintains close relationships with Singapore, where it is estimated that hundreds of Chinese companies have changed in recent years in an attempt to avoid the impact of geopolitical and commercial tensions between Washington and Beijing. Singapore, which has a strong regulatory system and low corporate taxes, also proved to be the ideal alternative to Hong Kong.

item.title: Economy | Inflation slowed to 0.19% in May
item.description: Inflation in Macao slowed in May, was announced on Friday, but the region escaped the fall in consumer prices, something that took place for the fourth consecutive month in the interior of China. The Consumer Price Index (IPC) in Macau rose 0.19 percent in May, in homologous terms, slower than the amount recorded in April (0.23 percent), according to official data released by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC). Although the CPI has dropped 0.05 percent compared to April, the territory escaped for the third consecutive month of deflation (annual fall in consumer prices). Deflation reflects weakness in domestic consumption and investment and is particularly severe, as a drop in the price of assets, as awarded to credit, generates an imbalance between the value of loans and bank guarantees. China, by far Macao's largest commercial partner, has been in consecutive months in deflation after the IPC has retreated 0.1 percent in May, the same amount recorded in April and March. According to Macao DSEC data, the deceleration of inflation in May is due to the cost of meals acquired away from home, which rose only 1.39 percent, while the expenditures on apartment mortgages increased only 0.42 percent. The housing price index fell 11.7 percent last year, notwithstanding Macau's monetary authority approved three interest rates in the last three months of 2024. Despite the increase in the number of visitors, the region registered a 2.5 percent drop in the price of clothing and footwear.

item.title: Teaching | I was entering local schools, but resources are scarce
item.description:
The government has been betting on the introduction of artificial intelligence in territory schools, but with a few hours in the curriculum. In addition, schools complain of few resources to meet government goals
Macao schools have integrated artificial intelligence tools (AI) in classrooms, such as smart paintings and linguistic models, but some teachers warn that most are not prepared to comply with outlined policy for the sector. After classes, students at Pui Va Secondary School remain in the classroom, distracted to explore a smart condition. These staff - explains Ruan Zhan Teng, school teacher at the school - act as interactive projectors and are used as soon as the first year, to write, watch videos or participate in classes with digital media. "In the third year, students begin to learn to identify artificial intelligence in everyday life, basic programming and photos and videos generated by AI," the computer teacher added to Lusa. The change took place in 2024 and is stipulated in the law: AI should be included in primary education (with a workload of 17 hours and 20 minutes per year), from 7th to 9th grade (19 hours and 20 minutes) and from 10th to 12th (18 hours and 40 minutes). Despite the requirement, Andy Chun Wai Fan, professor and director of the University of Macao Information and Communication Center in Education, Note that schools face two obstacles: lack of resources and faculty formation. “Some schools have only one information technology teacher,” said Fan, also referring that institutions generally have computer classes only once a week. Do not update Pedro Lobo, a teacher in this area, with 30 years of experience in the territory, including at the Portuguese School of Macau, is concerned about the lack of training. "Most teachers are already a certain age, they have not grown with this new technology ... So the mindset is still short of all this evolution, and change is being so fast that it can hardly follow," explained the Portuguese. Education authorities require teachers 30 hours of annual IA training, however, Pedro Lobo considers not sufficient. Although this year has already studied almost 40 hours, the teacher says he is "little prepared". Regarding this government policy, Andy Chun Wai Fan also remembers that it is required to schools that address ethics, innovation and collaboration in the domain of AI, although it fits the institutions the creation of the manuals themselves. “We do not have a manual about what to teach (…), each school has its own ideas about what to do with its students,” wolf reacted, explaining that he teaches “transferring AI to school work”, either through image generation, small game development, AI ethics approach and copyright issues. Since 2021 at PUI VA In a different record, the Pui Va Secondary School, which introduced AI in 2021, assumes to be “well prepared” to “the change”. The institution spends about two million patacas a year on AI tools, employs seven information technology teachers (IT) and hired a university professor in Beijing to support. “We want students to be able to use artificial intelligence to identify problems and solve real -life problems,” noticed the IT Office Director of Chinese educational establishment, Chong Wai Yin. Here, students work, for example, with programming languages ​​(Python, Tencent, Iflytek), and AI models such as Deepseek and ChatgPT, engaging in intelligent city projects, in the first cycle, and in the creation of applications, at a later stage, said Zhao Qihao, former professor at the University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, who taught in Puija VA. “In the first cycle, we developed smart cities, automated houses and AI -powered parking systems (…). In the second cycle, students create mobile applications and sustainable technological projects,” he explained. In April, the Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture, LAM, announced that Macao's educational reforms for 2025 will focus on AI and include plans for an intelligent classroom in all schools. The Government of Macao attributed to the school network under the direction of the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ) 15 million PATACA for AI software for this academic year. In an email sent to Lusa, DSEDJ stated that the government “attributes great importance” to the teaching of information technologies. "The medium and long term plan for non-higher education (2021-2030) identified 'reinforcement of creativity and technological education' as one of the main directions of development," he explains in the note. However, Pedro Lobo questions the pressure on young students: "Are we seeing children 8, 9, 10 years old to develop applications? Maybe 1 percent is capable. The rest does the best they can. They have classes and homework that never end." Concerned deputies In the last debate of the Legislative Assembly, last Thursday, two deputies, Iau Teng Pio and Kou Kam Fai, linked to education, defended the need for “high quality development of education in Macao”, namely with the bet on AI. One of the suggestions, referred to during the interventions before the order of day, was the reinforcement of the “coordinated development mechanism between education, scientific and technological innovation and talents”, with the increase of “Stem resources [science, technology, engineering and mathematics] and artificial intelligence on basic education, rooting the basis of scientific literacy”. In the debate on the 11th of this month, it was up to Deputy Ma Io Fong to appeal to AI regulation to avoid scams, but also to increase the awareness of society in relation to this new reality. “With the rapid development of technology these days, the use of AI functions is gradually becoming important help for society and residents in daily life and work. However, AI can give rise to illicit acts, especially the worsening cyber attacks and the diffusion of false information.” Also during the period of interventions before the agenda, the deputy asked the executive to “reinforce sensitization and education on the prevention of AI fraud, to sensitize the elderly and young people, emphasizing that the dissemination of false videos generated by AI can be a legal offense with serious consequences”. In this context, the systematic integration of “AI safety knowledge in school curricula and the realization of different awareness and education activities with community associations was requested to increase public knowledge about AI technology and the risk derived for its abuse”. "It is also due, through cooperation between the government, society, schools and the family, to reinforce the ability to respond to information and the internet discourse, allowing to react, clarify and follow up on useful time, when the public faces information that can cause negative influences or be misleading," said Ma Io Fong in the 11th debate.

item.title: History | The MA-chan escape to the colonial and macau
item.description:
The MA-chan family is from Mozambique with Chinese roots, sought its new path in the then colonial Portugal and since 1976 that set roots in Macao. José Manuel Machon, resident in the territory since he was 13, told Lusa the very peculiar trajectory of his family, which reflects many of the family directions taken in the years of war and the end of the Portuguese colonial empire
The MA-chan, the Mozambican family with roots in China, fled twice to communism and twice resumed in colonial Portugal. In 1976, they landed in Macao, where Mozambique's memory had erased with the departure of the Landins, African troops that parked in the territory for decades since 1912. According to a report by Luís Andrade de Sá published in Macau magazine in 1992, and quoted by the blog "Chronicles Macanese", the Landins were in Macao "for about five decades", and "the Chinese never used to their conviviality, suspiciously who had the huge blacks who played a horrible drumsticks while returning the ostensiva. ferocity ”. The term Landim became a reference “to identify all indigenous battalions that passed by Macau”, is described in the same report. Massá Ma-chan went in 1963 to the Namphlam, northern Mozambique Conservatory to register the fifth son, but once again denied this Chinese, with roots in Guangzhou, the transmission of the nickname to descent. José Manuel was the same as his brothers: the nickname Machon, corruption of MA-chan. The identity of José Manuel Machon, embryoly marked by this bureaucratic detail imposed by the then Portuguese Mozambique, is not only a reflection of the colonial past of Portugal, but from the beginnings of Sino-Mozambican relations. “I don't have great confusion, I tried to adapt to life,” he tells Lusa in Macau, where he has lived since he was 13. The grandfather-also MA-chan-was the one who defined that this story began in Africa, leaving China looking for better life, in the starter of the twentieth century, and settling in Nampula, alongside Sharing, a Macua woman, Mozambican ethnic group. Massá, the son -and father of José Manuel -was sent to Guangzhou at 14, to receive formal education there. When he returns to Mozambique, he is a married man with a bullet mark near his left shoulder. In China, he faced the Japanese in World War II and married a Chinese, which he met on the day of marriage, until, on the threshold of the civil war, which would victory to Mao Zedong's communists, fled. He dedicated himself to Nampula to the cucumber of the cucumber-the 'Magojojo'-and the tubar bit, which he exported to Hong Kong. The Great Return However, unable to adapt, the woman returned to Macao with her four children, where she died. Massá returned to marry, this time with a Mozambican - José Manuel came first, Carla later. When the Frelimo flag raised on the mast in Mozambique on June 25, 1975, the MA-chan-headed Macao, with a brief passage in Portugal, where they inhabited a pension paid by the then IARN. “We are nothing returned, because we have not returned anywhere, we are refugees,” says Carla Machon, residing in Portugal. “When my father heard again about communism, he fled,” says his brother, José Manuel. While speaking, bowling balls pack on the floor and travel the track to a new crash. The noise in the center of Bowling Future Bright does not seem to bother this big man, 61, fluent in Cantonese and Portuguese and president of Macao Bowling Club. “This is what keeps me stable. Instead of going to the glasses, I come here,” he notes. For Joseph, independence "it was an open openness, an opening to the world." It doesn't even talk about political reasons, but how important it was to cross half a world until you arrived in Macau. A new life In this page turn, the MA-chan/maachon family came to find, in 1976, a city with little civil presence abroad. José and Carla do not remember other Mozambicans, who began to arrive after independence, many from Portugal. Mong-Há's fortress is an old witness to Mozambique's presence in Macau. Then the Landins, Mozambican soldiers at the service of the Colonial Army were quartered, recalls journalist João Guedes, a scholar in the history of Macao. It is this historical circumstance that baptized the hill of Mong-há of “Mountain of Black Ghosts”. These troops, with the “greatest warrior instinct”, in the expression of Emperor Gungunhana, remained in Macao half a century, until around the 1960s. They were responsible, for example, by the storage of the siege gates, border of the territory with China and recurring incident place. “They passed by and faded as if they had never been,” resumes Guedes, indicating that there was no material heritage attesting this military presence. Not far from Mong-Há, but at the Riquexó restaurant, troops are still there, eternalized in photos hanging on the walls. This serves African chicken, macanese dish, whose origin is still today the target of debate. Two theories: It was created by the Portuguese chief Américo Ângelo, inspired by a trip to Mozambique. Another version realizes that, seeing the African soldiers missing roasted chicken, Americo made the dish. And the memory of macau-moca-mandamous relationships is not complete without evoking the trafficking in leaf. If, on the one hand, it is known that the Portuguese took slaves from the African colonies by settling in the doors of China, in reverse, were also sent via Macao, Chinese to work in Mozambique, often in slavery conditions. The sons were part of a migratory movement from the late nineteenth century, “to develop the Mozambican colony,” explains the professor at Joaquim Chissano University in Maputo, Fatima Papelo, who investigates Sino-Mozambican cooperation. The first group, he says, was sent in 1858 and "consisted of 30 men." More than a century later, in the struggle for Mozambican independence, Beijing supported the Liberation Front of Mozambique (Frelimo) and is one of the first countries to recognize the new sovereign state. In Macao, the reinforcement of the ties was later paid, with the transition from the territory of Portugal to China in 1999. But for José Manuel, Mozambique was always present. The last time it went, tells, visited and cleaned the family campaign, "there at Machamba". "It's a Chinese custom," he explained.

However, not satisfied with the situation, Wong Wai Man picked up a taxi towards the mud, eventually taking refuge on the roof. "I had no other option, CCAC wanted to chase me to death. Regarding the use of money in these games, Wong Wai Man said there was always a sign to say that it was forbidden to be bets on money and that there was, at the association's headquarters, a box for donations, but that was intended for voluntary support of the partners to help the association's operation. This is because, according to this, besides being president is also the only one to support all expenses of the Association of Iron and Steel shipowners, namely those related to income, water and light, considering that since 2014 that the entity has not received subsidies. One thing is certain: the association's headquarters will close doors tomorrow due to the end of the lease. "In 2007 my wife was pregnant and the hospitals convinced her to end her pregnancy because the baby's survival rate would be 50 percent, due to the fact that a fetal anomaly was detected after the exams. I insisted and the government eventually paid the operation worth 70 thousand patacas. So I want to make my contribution to repay a favor" to heaven "," he said. Six days without bathing According to the All About Macau newspaper, Wong Wai Man reported that he was still six days without bathing and sleeping, having remained a week missing until he performed with CCAC this Monday. Before he did, he said he was a total of six days detained, which for himself was “torture”, and that in total was all this time without bathing, sleeping or changing clothes. On Sunday, you will have been able to go home. "Last night [Tuesday] I finally managed to sleep well and bathe. I was six days without being able to bathe or change my clothes," he explained. The climb to the roof of the house in the mud was also a form of protest by the way it was treated, he said. The detention took place at dawn last Wednesday, the 11th, between 3 am and 4 am, with the argument that Wong Wai Man would maintain an illegal Mahjong business. It was then that he was detained for 48 hours in a squad in the mud, and was then transferred to the Public Prosecution Service (MP) to continue to make statements. After this process, he was notified to present himself with CCAC, having signed the requested documents. He was then arrested again for another 48 hours and transferred again to the MP. When, already on the street, he was again informed that he would have to return to CCAC to sign more documents, decided to escape and take refuge on the roof.

item.title: Coloane | Filipe Afonso launches work that highlights the importance of staff houses
item.description:
The latest book by Filipe Afonso, coordinator of the Architecture course at the University of São José, looks at a housing model at risk of disappearing, but can be seen in Coloane, or in old fishing zones of Hong Kong. “Coloane Grammar” presents alternative solutions for the reuse of these houses and their classification as a heritage
Taking the idea of ​​grammar that names the book, what are the main terms or concepts around Coloane, its tradition and preservation that can enumerate? The “grammar” of the book introduces the concept of vernacular architecture, which reflects the knowledge of the informal, local construction and the maritime identity of this Coloane community. It addresses the assets at risk, proposing a method of cataloging existing houses, this digital method, which establishes a dialogue between tradition and modernity to preserve this cultural landscape. What concrete proposals are suggested in the book for the protection and preservation of Coloane's stilts? The book proposes (indirectly) the classification of stilts as a heritage to give them legal protection. By cataloging existing stilts, the book contributes to preserving the memory of this type of architecture and a broader discussion about its possible protection. How could we reuse the stilts taking into account these specific ways of life and the economic diversification that the government wants to achieve? The stilts could be reused for experience tourism, or centers of cultural interpretation, valuing local history. They can be transformed into creative and artistic spaces or in fact propose new wood buildings along the water line, with various uses and that can generate value to the Coloane community, contributing to Macao's cultural and economic diversification. Why approach Coloane and the stilts? How did this project come about? Coloane and the stilts were approached by their architectural and cultural uniqueness, representing a threatened memory and identity of Macao. This assets at risk has a significant potential. The project also emerged from the gap of scientific knowledge about these structures and the urgent need for documentation, consolidating itself as an academic-scientific investigation. In the Asian or Southeast Asian context, are the coloane stilts or not unique in architectural terms? Water constructions are common in various Asian countries, Coloane's stilts are not a unique case in terms of existence. See the example, in Hong Kong, of the well-known Tai o village, but are unique in their specific context. Its architecture is the reflection of local regional influences and materials, adapted to the history of the evolution of Colona's fishing community and the development of Macao. Its value lies in its particular architectural language and its persistence in a rapidly transformed urban environment. What is the story behind the emergence of stilts? Are you associated with Coloane piracy reports, for example, which refer to the early twentieth century? The stilts emerged as a practical and functional solution to the sea -related way of life, allowing sea access, tidal protection and efficient use of space in coastal areas. Piracy reports in Coloane were not the direct cause of their emergence. Shapes are essentially the response of an informal architecture of local communities to adapt to the maritime environment. Museum Idea on Coloane Stop Stand since 2017 The need for preservation of coloane stilts is not a recent idea. Between 2017 and 2018, the Directorate of Tourism Services proposed the creation of a museum entirely dedicated to the stories of these dwellings arranged in Rua dos Navegantes, but the project was being postponed for legal reasons. In 2018, the Tribuna de Macao newspaper (JTM) published an article where it referred precisely the absence of “legal foundations” for the construction of new infrastructure in the Maritime area of ​​Macao, something that has changed, however, given that the MSAR passed, from 2018, to include in its jurisdiction the management of 85 square kilometers of maritime zones. Last year alone, the executive's plans for the creation of a “functional maritime zoning”, “maritime areas” and other related laws, and a concrete decision on what will be made on what will be made on the stilts. Both zoning and plan will be defined for a temporal period by 2040. One of the objectives of the executive is environmental and ecological preservation, as well as certain experiences of the population. One of the points of the public consultation report speaks of “optimizing ocean exploration modalities according to Macau's development needs; coordinating the use of sea in production, daily life of the population and ecology” and performing “intensive and economizers uses to realize the rational allocation of maritime resources”. In 2018, according to the JTM, STD assured that it would be necessary to “wait for the publication of the maritime area and administrative regulation on the administration of the use of maritime zones” and only then could the museum plan. HM questioned STD of this article, and until the closing of this edition, obtained new clarifications. A gradual development In a master's dissertation in architecture, defended in 2023 at the University of Coimbra, Ana Rita Rodrigues made the study of the “Evolution of Macao Territory-Aterros and Urban Design in the Taipa and Coloane islands”, and concluded that “Portuguese occupation in the islands of Taipa and Coloane brought improvements in infrastructure, safety and village organization”. In the late nineteenth century, "there were already, in the islands, schools, hospitals and basic infrastructure, promoting the economic growth of the region." Referring to the existence of stilts “used for the construction of fishing and housing boats for fishermen, naturally facing the river”, in a coloane zone composed “by precarious housing of one or two floors, unlike the type of common housing found in mud or macao, which was more focused on high development”. The author also points out that “development was slower” in Coloane, as well as the absence, on both islands, of “a unified general plan and the need for better urban planning to ensure a cohesive and sustainable environment”.

item.title: Breast Cancer | Research of one does “revolutionary discovery”
item.description:
A study by a team led by two professors at the University of Macao seeks answers to combat breast cancer. Academics concluded that cancer cells spread mainly through the lymphatic system, not by the bloodstream
“The lymphatic system is the main route for breast cancer dissemination and metastasis, revealed by tracking unique cell lineage” is a scientific article that seeks to increase knowledge that allows you to find solutions to the disease. The work was developed by a research team led by the full professor Chuxia Deng and assistant professor Miao Kai at the University of Macao Faculty of Health Sciences (one) and, according to a note from UM, is a “revolutionary discovery in the study of cancer metastases”. Thus, and for the first time, “a qualitative and quantitative analysis of the machine cancer metastases was made, and was applied by scientists“ a barcode system based on a unique cell lineage tracking approach ”called Celltag. With this method, results were obtained that reveal that "cancer cells spread mainly through the lymphatic system, not by the bloodstream." In addition, he points out one, “research also found that interaction between tumor cells and the tumor microenvironment (TME) determines the metastatic potential of cancer cells”, ie whether or not they may easily reproduce. In this sense, “the study systematically demonstrates the roads of tumor metastases and opens new ways for the development of cancer treatment strategies”, is described. The article was published in the magazine “Molecular Cancer” and is the result of an investigation by a vast team, consisting of Kai Miao, Aíping Zhang, Xiaodan Yang, Yipeng Zhang, Anqi Lin, Lijian Wang, Xin Zhang, Heng Sun, Jun Xu, Yuzhao Feng, Fangyuan Shao, Sen Guo, Zhihui Weng, Peng Luo, Xiaoling Xu and Ch -xia Deng. Highlight for the collaboration of scientists from other higher education institutions in the region, such as Aiping Zhang, Hong Kong-Shenzhen Hospital University, and Jingyao Zhang and Shuai Gao, linked to China Agricultural University in Beijing. In turn, Dong Wang and Xiao-Yang Zhao are linked to Southern Medical University's School of Basic Medical Sciences in Guangzhou. Microenvironment is an important factor One explains, in the same statement, that the study in question “provides empirical evidence for route preference in cancer metastasis”, demonstrating that tumor cells are “pre-programmed” with “intrinsic information that determine their metastatic potential”, and these cells “adapt dynamically their genetic expression based on the target organs”. Thus, "these findings establish the foundations for the development of therapies directed to lymphatic metastasis, such as the inhibition of cytokine signaling or the interruption of communication between tumor and stroma to suppress metastasis." In the investigation, the “single cell RNA sequencing technology” was used, which allowed the team to “discover that genetically identical tumor cells exhibit profiles of specific genetic expression of the organ”, so the microenvironment proves to be “fundamental in the formation of tumor cell behavior”. "For example, pulmonary metastatic cells positively regulate oxidative stress -related genes, while hepatic metastatic cells activate metabolic regulatory pathways," is referred to. The danger of metastases One points out that, in cancer diseases, metastases are the main cause of death. However, to date, "the mechanisms that govern the selection of the route" of these same metastases remained "obscure." “Using Celltag technology, the research team traced the spread of breast cancer cells on mice models,” discovered that “less than 3 percent of cancer cells spread throughout the bloodstream, while more than 80 percent metasta through the lymphatic system for distant organs such as lungs and liver”. Thus, "further analysis has shown that lymph spread cells have distinct genetic expression patterns and communicate closely with stromal cells, such as endothelial fibroblasts and cells in the microenvironment, forming an adaptive" seed-solo "mechanism." Olhando para o estudo, os autores explicam que a metástase do cancro “é um processo no qual as células tumorais do tumor primário invadem a membrana basal dos vasos sanguíneos ou linfáticos (intravasação), viajam pelo sistema sanguíneo ou linfático e colonizam órgãos e ou tecidos distantes para continuar o seu desenvolvimento”. Vários estudos apontam para o facto de as metástases serem responsáveis por 70 a 90 por cento da mortalidade relacionada com o cancro, sendo que “a disseminação de células tumorais na vasculatura e nos vasos linfáticos ocorre simultaneamente na grande maioria dos cancros”. Blood roads In the discussion of the results, the study authors say that, in general terms, “tumor cells metastatize mainly through blood circulation and lymphatic system”, and until the publication of this work had been performed “numerous studies to distinguish the role of both systems in the various phases of cancer metastasis”, without knowing “which way’ for metastasis ”. It is referred to in the article, citing other studies that “cancer cells enter the bloodstream through intravasation to become CTCs [Circulating Tumor Cells-Tumor Cells in circulation], having revealed highly correlated with the survival results of breast cancer patients”. The authors also explain that “the lymphatic system is considered critical for metastasis” because “melanoma cells with experience in the lymphatic system were more resistant to ironPtosis and formed more metastases”, and in cases of “cancer tumor resection, cancer cells can further disseminate the lymphatic ganglia for blood vessels and form tumors and forming tumors metastatic in the lungs ”. To date, “although metastatic dissemination was viable by both ways, the relative importance of each process for a certain type of cancer and the target organ was unknown due to the lack of adequate quantitative tools”, something to which this study, using the celltag system, intended to respond. Thus, "we demonstrate that most lung and liver metastatic cells can be detected in the lymphatic system rather than CTCs [circulation tumor cells] derived from the blood, indicating that the lymphatic vessels can be the favorite way for tumor cell metastasis, at least in breast cancer." The authors promise not to stop here in the discovery of the course made by the metastasis of carcinogenic cells, having already performed "preliminary tests" with some cells in order to find out the possibility of "drastic" reduction of tumor cells disseminated by lymphatic. "We will continue to work on this to deepen the lymphatic dissemination mechanism and explore therapeutic interruptions in our future efforts," he is mentioned.

item.title: Commerce | CUPPA Coffee manager calls for support to Portuguese companies
item.description:
The story of Cuppa Coffee dates back to 2008 when it was hard to find a space in Macau to drink good coffee. The location in the old mud brought fame to the project, but the space ended up closing doors and moving to Studio City. João Incarnation, who manages coffee, speaks of the news and the importance of supporting Lusophone matrix projects
It all started in the mind of Portuguese Cristiana Figueiredo, at a time when for a Portuguese or passionate about coffee living in Macau it was hard to find a space to enjoy this drink accompanied by bakery or pastry products, in good Portuguese way. Cristiana Figueiredo said, in an interview with the Macao Commerce and Investment Promotion Institute (Ipim), which led her to invest in this type of business. "In Europe, people have a habit to go to coffee and to work for work. When I came to Macau for over 20 years, I realized that the Portuguese coffee culture is not popular in Macao, so I was born the idea of ​​opening a coffee in Macao, hoping to promote the food and culture of Portuguese coffee." Since 2008, Cuppa Coffee, associated with the initial project of the businesswoman, Nata Bakery, founded in 2007 and focused on bakery and pastry products, has become one of the favorite spaces of the Portuguese, foreign and even resident of the territory. However, the direction of the economic environment, with greater difficulties in paying lace, has dictated some transformations to the project, which now ends doors to the entrance of Taipa Velha and also with Lakes Nam Van, to be only in the Studio City venture in Cotai. The closure in the lakes Nam Van took place in January. At HM, João Incarnation, director and shareholder of the company that generates Cuppa Coffee, explains that, in fact, the change to the Cotai was decided for a long time. "I often say that there was no change to Studio City, because this was a plan that already existed and that came regardless of the taipa store closure. We would always open this space regardless of whether we continue, or not, with the store in the mud, whose closure was due to a failed negotiation regarding space income." According to João Incarnation, who today generates the company with Nicole Massa Helm, both considered that "in the current economic situation there was no conditions to continue in that space, which is relatively large and had its costs." "We needed to contain if we wanted the business to continue to work, because the alternative is always to close completely. We did not give up on the idea of ​​opening anything in the mud and being a little closer to our regular and more faithful customers, so we continue to open another establishment in the mud that can serve customers who live there. Therefore, there is no proper trip to Stadio City," João said, " Incarnation. The director and shareholder understands that this change always causes some nostalgia. “We pity it to have closed it. It cost us, we really have a lot of pity,” he confessed. "It was a decision that could have been made longer, at least a year, but we still tried to keep the establishment there, but we were not possible. We will see what the future reserves us." Despite these changes, Cuppa Coffee can be considered a successful case. "It worked there for many years and it worked well. This is a business that has to have certain conditions to work because, as we know, it has a lot of movement, but with little performance regarding each client. It is a business that needs many customers to support themselves, and for many years, at the level of rent values ​​and everything else, suppliers for example, it was much cheaper and things worked better," he recalls. The location in Taipa Velha gave Cuppa Coffee “a very large recognition and clientele”, despite the growing difficulties. "As prices were increasing, we also needed to increase our prices, but never in proportion to the increase in expenses. There was a time when we could not continue," he assumed. What the future reserves João Incarnation ensures that what customers have always sought in this space will continue in Studio City: good coffee and pastry products, with the presence of Portugal. "We always try to introduce new products. We created a new, coffee and coconut -based drink, which is excellent. We also introduced the" Nata Bomb ", a Milkshake Beat Concept flavored Nata, a true bomb," he described. There are also “traditional Portuguese products that did not exist before, such as bay bread”, as well as the donuts with different flavors, “to complete the offer we have”. "Our offer is already so varied that, even without introducing more products, it is sufficient to satisfy the values ​​of Portuguese customers and others as well." John Incarnation also said that the change of establishment to Studio City was born from an invitation. “We don't know how to run yet, it's a bet that we are making right now”, and the goal is always to go back to street coffee. "The concept of having a neighborhood store or on the street is something that interests us a lot and we are already seeing other possibilities," he added. "I don't have enough data to tell you that the change to Studio City is a winning bet. It's different, just like the concept, and we will have another type of customers beyond the usual." A “Heart” project Looking back, John Incarnation says that, for example, major problems have never been registered with human resources. "To this day we do not feel the big problem with lack of labor, it has never been something that has greatly affected us. Nowadays it is not as easy as it used to have quotas [for non-resident workers], as there are enough places that need placement. It is able to be easier, at this time, to get more local workers than before," he said, confirming that lace remain to be the big problem for such business. “Cuppa Coffee is a project of the heart and during the pandemic I realized that I was going to close. I also realized that there was a series of closures, almost simultaneously, from other Portuguese establishments. Talk to my partner, who has a lot of experience in this area, and told him that I liked to try to keep Cuppa Coffee open. Possible to continue exactly the same concept and the same quality as it had been having with Cristiana, who did an excellent work in the creation and growth of Cuppa Coffee. ” Overcoming the pandemic years, and at a time when Macau faces a break in local consumption, João Incarnation says that "it fulfills a bit to the Portuguese community to make the possible to support the effort we do so that everything is still open." "I am not just talking about Cuppa Coffee, but also from wheat d'Ouro, butteria, Portuguese restaurants and Lord Stow, which is not a typical Portuguese business is based on Portuguese culture. All these businesses have to be fed and supported. For our part, we must maintain quality, but the Portuguese community has to take advantage of what exists and support the Portuguese business." Despite the breach of consumption by the places, João Incarnation says that a balance with the consumption of tourists is guaranteed. "We feel a little [Break of consumption], but we can counterbalance with the offers we make and that satisfy the taste of local Chinese and visitors. But of course [Breaking of Consumption] has, of course, impact on business, not just the Portuguese, and this is in the city. item.title: Entrepreneurship | Event for local companies wants to capture “angel investors”
item.description:
Macau today hosts an event designed to capture the so -called “angel investors” for local entrepreneurship projects. Macao Angel Investor Network takes place at “The Macao Young Entrepreneur Incubation Center” and aims to support emerging business projects or simply startups that are taking the first steps
It's called “Macau Angel Investor Network”, anything like “Angel Investor Network in Macao” and aims to bring residents closer who want to be successful entrepreneurs and create their own business in an economy that wants to diverse. The event is scheduled for today at Hengqin Development Center, at 517 Avenida da Praia Grande, Nam Tung commercial building, between 11h and 12h30, and has several personalities linked to the local economy, but not only. They are Raphael Chan, Deputy Director of the Directorate of Economics and Technological Development Services (DSEDT), Paulo Andrez, Emeritus President of the “European Business Angel Network” and also figures such as Emanuel Soares, Legal Consultant, U Man Fai, angel investor for the Great Bay and Founder/founder of “Esenia Fund” and even Ung Choi Kun, former deputy to the Legislative Assembly and president of Kun Cheong Holding Ltd and also an “angel investor”. The event is developed by the Association for Entrepreneurship and Innovation for Macao, China and Portuguese-speaking countries, which is linked Marco Duarte Rizzolio, being co-organized by the Macao Sino-Buspone Platform Association for sustainable development. To HM, this explained the main objectives that are behind this initiative. "We want to connect an angel investors to startups and small and medium enterprises (SMEs), fostering the entrepreneurial ecosystem and promoting the economic diversification of Macao." In turn, Alvin Fong, also linked to the organization of this event and president of Direch International, argued that it is intended to “create a platform that brings together knowledge about angel investments, helping in the diversification of Macao's economy”. According to Rizzolio, "Investors Angel, who invest capital in emerging companies, are fundamental to support startups in early stages where financing possibilities are more scarce in the traditional financial sector." “In addition,” he said, the contact network that now runs on Praia Grande Avenue “seeks to bring investors closer to Portuguese -speaking and China countries, creating mutual access to the best projects developed in these regions and reinforcing Macao as a strategic link between the East and the West”. For Alvin Fong, this is the "opportune moment" for the holding of such an event, given that "the world is going through many changes and new opportunities are emerging." According to Marco Duarte Rizzolio, in Macao have already occurred in previous events in an attempt to capture angel investments, "but this is the first time a" Business Angels "network has been created in Macao with Chinese investors and Portuguese -speaking countries." "The conditions to hold this event now arise from various factors, such as the accelerated growth of innovation and technology, the greater digitization and the use of software in business, the need to diversify the local economy, the growing focus on the great bay as a pole of innovation," he said. At issue, there are also factors such as “the joint effort of public and private entities in creating an environment favorable to entrepreneurship”, something that has been greatly enhanced by the pandemic years, defended, having brought Macao and the authorities “a new understanding of the importance of supporting local and regional businesses, making this moment particularly strategic”. Who is who For today's session were invited “Successful Entrepreneurs and Entrepreneurs, some of whom are leaders in their areas”, and their “experience and intelligence add a lot to this event,” said Alvin Fong. Already Marco Duarte Rizzolio, stressed that will be present “people interested in technology and innovation, including some angel investors, representatives of risk capital funds, renowned entrepreneurs and specialists in innovation and business development”. Today's session is an “opportunity to obtain valuable knowledge and expand the network of contacts”, and Marco Duarte Rizzolio highlights personalities such as Paulo Andrez, “recognized international expert in entrepreneurship, innovation and angel investment”, or Ung Choi Kun, “prominent figure in Macao in real estate and education sectors, as well as an angel investor in several companies”. Asked about the main areas in which this initiative is focused on, Rizzolio adds that the event is focused on “startups and SMEs that act on sectors such as technology, intelligent tourism, green economy, health, digital education, logistics or finance”, because they are “sectors with high growth potential and that are aligned in local needs”, namely in the “1+” economic diversification strategy or “1+4” strategy global trends ”. "We want to identify innovative companies that can thrive not only in Macao, but also in the big bay and in international markets," added this official who is also linked to the organization of the startups and entrepreneurship contest, the "929 Challenge". Right moment For Alvin Fong, Macao currently presents potentialities for the connection of business projects to the cities of the Great Bay, all located in Guangdong Province. "Macau has a lot of freedom and flexibility to experience new ideas. In addition, we have received many tourists from around the world. Being one of GBA's eleven cities, Macau is, in fact, an excellent platform," he said. In turn, Marco Duarte Rizzolio speaks of “unique characteristics” of the territory, “like their position as a bridge between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, a stable regulatory environment and tax and financial incentives that can attract investors and startups”. There is also “the increase in the focus on the diversification of the economy beyond the game sector”, with “a fertile ground for innovation and new business”. "In a global scenario of low interest rates, capital markets with some geopolitical friction, investment in technology has presented multiple incomparable from other assets. In this context, the creation of more financial incentives and the strengthening of startup support programs are crucial steps," said the event co-creator. Great competition Despite the potential, the challenges persist, given that “Macao does not have many advantages beyond the game sector,” there is “intense competition in the big bay,” warned Alvin Fong. For Marco Duarte Rizzolio "Challenges are significant," because "the transition from an economy so dependent on the game sector to a more diverse model takes time and requires coordinated efforts." It is also necessary to take into account the opportunities that arise with the integration of MSar on Hengqin Island, Rizzoolio said, which recalls, however, “the challenges related to competitiveness and regulatory adaptation”. "In addition, housing and commercial remodeling requires balance between economic growth and the preservation of local social fabric. It is essential to create policies that encourage entrepreneurship and investment, minimizing the negative impacts of these transformations," he said. Asked whether the authorities have been enough to capture angel investors, both argue that there is more work to do. "This is a good start, but more can be done in the future," said Alvin Fong. Already Marco Duarte Rizzolio, said that "the Government of MSAR has made important efforts", as well as mentioning "several times the need to create a" Business Angels "network." “Macau has supported many initiatives that aim to stimulate investment. It is true that the creation of more financial incentives and the strengthening of startup support programs are crucial steps. It is also necessary to promote Macau more actively as an attractive destination for investors, highlighting its competitive advantages on the international scene. This event is an example of good collaboration between the public and private sector to stimulate ecosystem,” said Rizzolio. Also noteworthy is that today's event is closely connected with 369, an entity that aims to become “an International Hub of Science and Technology in Macao, giving new generations a greater stage of exploration” of opportunities, ”said Alvin Fong, president of this entity. Marco Duarte Rizzolio stressed that we are facing “an incubator of the Macao ecosystem that has organized several events”.

item.title: Celebrated a new agreement to send inert materials to the interior
item.description: The government of Macao and the Ministry of Ecology and Environment of the Interior have signed an agreement for the MSA to send to the other side of the border the inert materials that result from construction works. The details of the agreement, such as the duration and any payments of the MSAR, were not revealed in yesterday's statement from the Secretary's Office for Transport and Public Works, which also did not indicate the date on which the agreement was signed. The document signed by the two parties is named “Cooperation Agreement for the management work of inert materials resulting from macao demolitions and constructions in the maritime areas of the interior of China” and was justified with “urgent needs to treat inert materials resulting from demolitions and macao constructions”. Although details were not known, it was indicated that the agreement resulted in a “long -term efficient mechanism for the disposal of inert materials resulting from masters and buildings in the maritime areas of the interior of China”. It is also indicated that the sending of inert materials has to respect “national norms”. LIMITS ASSEMENT The agreement was justified with the construction works of the eastern east line, and the use of drilling machines that will reach depths greater than 40 meters below the sea surface. "Considering that soils to excavate with this type of perforator come from the depths of the underground and have a relatively simple composition, and considering that the only landfill for construction materials in Macau is already saturated, the problem of the destination resulting from the excavations arises," was indicated. "If this problem is not resolved as soon as possible, it will have a serious impact on the progress of the main subsistence infrastructure projects in Macao," he was explained. "Thus, the inert materials resulting from macao demolitions and buildings that meet national requirements (including soils produced by tunnel drilling machine and soft soils) will be treated in the maritime areas of the interior of China," he was added.

item.title: Eleicons | Wong wai man definitely deleted
item.description:
The chairman of the Electoral Affairs Commission of the Legislative Assembly confirmed yesterday the definitive removal from the Wong Wai Man list, after the activist, known as 'Captain Macau', did not appeal the exclusion
"We have not received any appeal or information about any appeal so far," Judge Seng Ioi Man said yesterday, who chairs the Electoral Affairs Committee of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal). According to the chronology of the electoral process, Wong Wai Man had only one day to appeal, to the Last Instance Court (TUI), of the rejection of the candidacy, a decision announced by Caeal on June 16. Tui would later have five days, until last Sunday, to make a “definitive decision” on exclusion. On June 10, Caeal gave Wong Wai Man two days to collect at least 78 signatures in support of its candidacy. This after the commission decides that of the 395 signatures submitted by the activist, only 222 were valid. C candidates must be presented with a minimum support of 300 voters. "Most of the signatures were not from voters who gather the conditions, there are also repetition of subscribers and signatures that do not correspond to the identity document," said Seng Ioi Man on June 16, noting problems with the list logo aid grassroots. The next day, Wong Wai Man, also president of the Iron and Steel Association, accused the political persecution authorities, said he was detained between June 11 and 16 and rejected the charges of electoral corruption and illicit exploitation of play. Reduced space On 14 June, the criminal courts applied coercion measures to five individuals, allegedly because they paid bribes to obtain support for candidates for the Legislative Assembly or for falsifying signatures. Wong Wai Man, also known as “Mao Soldier” for often appearing with a green uniform and a bag with the face of former Chinese leader Mao Zedong, ensured that he had no money to pay bribes. Caeal President Seng Ioi Man said yesterday that he did not or will ask for information from the commissioner against corruption, because the investigation is still "under the secret of justice." These will be the first elections after the exclusion in 2021 of five lists and 21 candidates, 15 of which pro-democracy, for “not defending the basic law” and not being “faithful to mashes”. The Electoral Commission validated eight requests for direct suffrage to the AL, less than the 19 initially filed in the previous elections in 2021. Thirty -three deputies are part of AL, 14 of which are elected by direct suffrage, 12 by indirect suffrage, through associations, and seven are appointed by the chief executive.

item.title: Hengqin | Sam Hou Fai wants complementarity with Nansha
item.description: The chief executive expects Guangzhou and Macau to strengthen the joint development of Nansha and Hengqin, complementing each other and, using their own advantages, perform well the functions of central cities of the Great Bay project. Sam Hou Fai's desire was expressed in another journey of the ruler for the cities of the Great Bay, this time in the provincial capital, Guangzhou. item.title: Public function | Request Review of Assiduity Control
item.description:
Nick Law suggested to the government the installation of identity recognition systems to reinforce the registration of attendance and absences of civil servants. The deputy requested the increase in inspection following a CCAC report relating to last year, where cases of counterfeit of presence were identified
The final report of the Commissioner Against Corruption (CCAC), relating to last year, revealed the increase of complaints compared to 2023, cases of abuse of the registration system and absences between administration officials, with particular emphasis on the most glaring cases involving the Public Security Police and customs services. CCAC's conclusions were the target of a written Nick Law interpellation, released yesterday, which linked a position of greater control of public services in the mechanisms of registration of attendance and absences. The deputy linked to the Fujian community asks the government to do “an exhaustive analysis of the current methods of registration of attendance of various public services”. In addition, it suggests the updating of attendance registration equipment through identity recognition systems to eliminate irregularities. The deputy argues that CCAC has shown that among the security forces there are those who "enjoy their positions", "frequently leaving during the service and even abandoning the territory." Nick Law also did not forget the role of doctors in obtaining false justification for long absence of the service, or situations where "some civil servants marked the point for each other." The legislator argues that "these violations not only harm the rule of law in Macao, but also affect society's confidence in the executive's governance." Devil in the details Nick Lei recalls that the CCAC report highlighted the work done to increase the awareness of the population and civil servants regarding the promotion of integral and honest conduct. Last year, 622 lectures, seminars, training workshops and activities of various types were held, with 41,901 participants, including civil servants, public and private institutions and students. However, CCAC revealed the increase in offenses to discipline and law committed by civil servants. As such, the deputy asks if the government will evaluate the effectiveness of these actions. Another area in which Nick Law would like to see improvements is in CCAC's own reports. The deputy indicates that the body failed to specify, from 2018, detailed statistics on the public services of complaints. The deputy suggested that CCAC will return to the public services of complaints "so that the public can know the problems of each functional area and facilitate the joint supervision of society."

item.title: Macau
item.description: In 2007 Pope Benedict XVI established the tradition of praying for the Catholic Church of China on May 24. On June 24, the day is celebrated when the residents of Macao repelled, in 1622, the Dutch invaders and all those who love the city should also pray for it, as in Macao there were too many unpleasant incidents lately. Bishop Stephen Lee Bun-Ssang of the Diocese of Macau wrote a pastoral letter to be read during Pentecost Sunday, which this year was celebrated on June 8, where he declared, “recently, there were several suicides and several suicide attempts in Macao. According to health services, 18 suicides were recorded in the first trimester of 2025, which evidences the urgent need for Taking measures to solve the problem. These tragedies not only bring deep pain to family members, but they also shake us all. lonely ». Unfortunately, in early May, other suicides were even more registered. The fact that they were not publicly disclosed does not mean that the tragedies did not happen. Ultimately, we release ourselves from the current depressing social atmosphere is the most effective path and, for that, we need to pray! The administrative measure that requires a person to live in Macau at least during 183 to benefit from the pecuniary reimbursement plan for economic development for the year 2025 also affected some residents who are outside the city, especially those living in Hong Kong, a city that is part of the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay. I noticed that there are in fact several opinions regarding the necessary conditions to benefit from this plan. The requirement of 183 days of permanence is not a problem in itself; The fundamental question lies in the calendar of its implementation. Last year, before the term of his mandate, former Ho Iat Seng Chief Executive announced that the pecuniary reimbursement plan for economic development for the year 2025 would not be changed, which citizens faced as good news. However, when the plan was implemented this year, the condition that determines the need to have remained in Macao in 2024, at least for 183 days, was added, which deprived some residents living outside the possibility of achieving this goal. If this measure had only had an effect from 2026, I believe it would have been less controversial and that the disagreements it caused among the residents would have been reduced. For some people, the amount of 10,000 patacas may seem insignificant, but for the very needy, especially the elders, no longer entitled to receive this value can be quite devastating. If the social atmosphere were a little more harmonious, there would be less tragedies. For this to happen, we need to pray! There are still a lot for which we have to pray. In 2022, the Legislative Assembly changed the “legal regime for the exploration of casino fortune or unlucky games”, which had a negative impact on the situation of the “satellite casinos” so most will close by the end of the year. I wonder what will be of the 4,800 employees of the game companies that work in the "satellite casinos". The doubt is and if they can maintain their current level of income or if their lives will be affected. The future of the 800 who worked on the "satellite casinos" but were not employees of the game companies, and the staff of the stores located around the satellite casinos also raises concern and it is not known if they will have any guarantee of subsistence. On the 17th, some journalists were prevented from entering the Legislative Assembly and covering the work session, an unusual event for members of the press. The subsistence of Macao residents and the maintenance of press freedom is equally important, so we pray for them! On June 24, 1622, the residents of Macao, who fought with all their strength to repel the Dutch forces, will certainly have prayed during the resistance!
